section.p: A floating point value in siemens representing electric admittance.
A floating point value in siemens per second representing electric admittance frequency.

Indicates that the system has switched or will immediately switch to a state which is outside the specified operating conditions. An alarm is reset automatically when its driving condition is no longer present.

Indicates that the system has switched or will immediately switch to a state which is outside the specified operating conditions. An alarm is reset automatically when its driving condition is no longer present.

behaviordef.name: alarm.inactive
behaviordef.label: Alarm tested when the device is not Active

section.hd: Alarm tested when the device is not Active

section.p: A floating point value in radians representing an angle.
A floating point value in degree representing an angle.
The value of this immediate property is the bit number of its parent property in its grandparent's bitmap.
This property is an immediate property that provides a comment on the parent property or device.
It differs from an acn.dms.bset:description that it has no function in the device itself, only in the DDL module.
A floating point value in siemens representing electric conductance.
A floating point value in ampère representing electric current.
A floating point value in ampère representing the root means square of an alternating electric current.
The property provides the date of manufacture or production of the device.
When used as refinement on a behavior definition: the use of the behavior is deprecated. Alternative behavior(s) should be mentioned in the description.
When used as behavior of property: the use of the property deprecated.
This property is an immediate property that provides a description of the parent property or device.
It can be a labelString (default) or a labelRef property in case translations of the text are wanted.
The description can e.g. be used as hint in the user interface, or as comment in generated code.
The property represents a mass per volume, expressed in kg/m³.
The property represents a mass per volume.
Dimension: M/L^3
The property represents a length per time.
Dimension: L/T
Velocity is a vector quantity v = dr/dt, where r is position vector and t is time.
Speed is the magnitude of velocity, thus speed = |v|.
The coherent SI unit of speed and velocity is [m/s].
Quantity equal to the mass dm of substance crossing a given surface during a time interval with infinitesimal duration dt, divided by this duration, thus qm = dm / dt
The coherent SI unit of mass flow rate is [kg/s].
The mass of matter flowing through a cross-section in unit time, expressed in kg/s.
The volume flowing through the cross-section of a conduit in unit time.
The coherent SI unit of volume flow rate is [m³/s].
A floating point value in joule representing (electric) energy.
A floating point value in kWh representing (electric) energy.
Discrepancy between a computed, observed or measured value or condition, and the true, specified or theoretically correct value or condition.
Note 1 to entry: An error within a system may be caused by failure of one or more of its components, or by the activation of a systematic fault.
Something happened.
A bit representing an event or event state. When true, the event has happened, or the event state is active. When false, the event has not happened, or the event state is not active.
The state of an item characterized by inability to perform a required function, excluding the inability during preventive maintenance or other planned actions, or due to lack of external resources.
A fault is only reset after acknowledgement.
The state of an item characterized by inability to perform a required function, excluding the inability during preventive maintenance or other planned actions, or due to lack of external resources.
A fault is only reset after acknowledgement.
A fault which is assessed as likely to result in injury to persons, significant material damage, or other unacceptable consequences.
A fault of an item that persists until an action of corrective maintenance is performed.
A fault that, in general, cannot be reset after acknowledgement without some form of maintenance. Typically, a power-up/reset of the controller is required to clear a persistent fault.
A floating point value in hertz representing a frequency.
A floating point value in rad/s representing an angular frequency.

behaviordef.name: knownConstant
behaviordef.label: A constant value that can be used to check the communication link.

section.p: A constant value that can be used to check the communication link.

A light property contains the value of a LED signal, which represents a single Read/Green/Blue multi-colour Light Emitting Diode (LED). The value is represented by a 32-bit integer, with an 8-bit intensity value per channel. The Blue channel is in the least significant byte (byte 0), the Green channel in byte 1, and the Red channel in byte 2. The most significant byte has no meaning.
Apart from three colour LEDs, the light property may represent two colour LEDs (e.g. red/green) as well. Obviously the unused channel has no meaning in that case.

behaviordef.name: limitMaxCodeUnits
behaviordef.label: Maximum number of String Code Units

section.hd: Maximum number of String Code Units
section.p: A type.string property is a Unicode string in UTF-8 encoding. The limitMaxCodeUnits sub-property defines a limit on the number of Code Units available for storing the string. For an UTF-8 string a Code Unit is an 8-bit word (octet or byte).
Note that the limitMaxCodeUnits equals the traditional Maximum Number of Characters for ASCII strings in UTF-8 encoding.

The actual memory allocated may be larger, depending on the patform's implementation of the string type. E.g. in C an additional byte may be required for storage of the NUL character that indicates the end of the string.
An Internet Protocol address (either IPv4 or IPv6).
Modifications of properties with this behavior are logged in a journal, i.e. registered with timestamp of modification.
Note: this seems to be something like trippable -and logged (if logged is more general than at regular intervals).
The value of a property with this behavior is logged at regular intervals.
A floating point value in kilogram representing mass.
An immediate property that contains the source code name of the object or variable representing the the parent property or device.
A floating point value in seconds representing a time period.
An integer value in seconds representing a time period.
A floating point value in watt representing (electrical) power.
A floating point value in pascal representing pressure.
A floating point value in bar representing pressure.
The pressure can be absolute or relative (e.g. gauge pressure), depending on the property.

section.html:p: The https://schema.org/mpn (Manufacturer Part Number) of the device or device component, a unique number in the Product Lifecycle Management system of the manufacturer.
The https://schema.org/productID of the device or device component, a unique identifier in the system context.
section.p: A typical implementation uses a dash-separated sequence of short identifiers, indicating the hierarchy of the part in the system.

section.html:p: The https://schema.org/name of the device or device component class.
The uniform resource identifier as https://schema.org/identifier of the device or device component class.
A typical implementation uses a Univerally Unique Identifier (UUID) conform RFC4122: urn:uuid:00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.
The https://schema.org/version of the device or device component class.
A typical implementation uses the Semantic Versioning 2.0.0 versioning system: 0.0.0-alpha+4263.2021-06-11.
The https://schema.org/productionDate of the device or device component instance.
section.p: The property provides the date of manufacture or production of the device or device component.
A typical implementation uses the ISO 8601 extended format, with 10 characters.
A value that defines a ratio of one property to another. Typically used to define a derived parameter, based on another parameter (persistent property).

section.html:p: The https://schema.org/releaseDate of the device or device component class.
section.p: The property provides the date of the release of the specific version of the device or device component.
A typical implementation uses the ISO 8601 extended format, with 10 characters.
A floating point value in ohm representing electric resistance.

section.html:p: The root mean square is a statistical measure of the magnitude of a varying quantity. It is calculated as the square root of the mean of the squares of the values.
The https://schema.org/serialNumber of the device or device component instance.
section.p: This property is a string containing the manufacturer's or producer's serial number or alphanumeric identifier of the product instance.
This string is intended primarily for human use, e.g when reporting service information, rather than as an identifier for automated decision making.
Manufacturers should take reasonable steps to ensure that no two devices they produce have the same value for this string.
Note: acnbase.bset:devSerialNo has acnbase.bset:constant behavior. This is too strict: we need to be able to 'setAtFactory' the value.

section.hd: Property value set on site during commissioning
section.p: A persistent property, normally a constant, of which the value is defined on site during commissioning.
A persistent property, normally a constant, of which the value is defined at the device factory.

section.hd: Property value set by customer at ordering
section.p: A persistent property, normally a constant, of which the value is defined by the customer at ordering.
A floating point value in m/s representing speed.
A floating point value in degree Celsius representing temperature.

section.html:p: A scale factor is a number which scales, or multiplies, some quantity.
An offset or displacement specifies the position of a point or a particle in reference to an origin or to a previous position.

section.p: The meaning and function of the bits in the bitmap is not defined here but may be defined by refinements of this behavior, or with sub-properties with behavior acn.dms.bset:type.bit.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Enum with the FlagsAttribute set.
Maps in C to the enumeration enum { ... } with the enumeration constants being the bitmask values of the respective bits.
Maps in C++11 to the scoped enumeration enum class : std::uint8_t { ... } with the enumeration constants being the bitmask values of the respective bits.
The meaning and function of the bits in the bitmap is not defined here but may be defined by refinements of this behavior, or with sub-properties with behavior acn.dms.bset:type.bit.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Enum with the FlagsAttribute set.
Maps in C to the enumeration enum { ... } with the enumeration constants being the bitmask values of the respective bits.
Maps in C++11 to the scoped enumeration enum class : std::uint32_t { ... } with the enumeration constants being the bitmask values of the respective bits.
A typing primitive for the members (sub-properties) of a bitmap property, where the bits have boolean semantics.

Since boolean semantics are the most common use for individual bits, rather than representing a binary integer, this typing primitive is refining the type.boolean behavior, rather than the type.integer behavior.
Does not map to a memory addressable data type, but can be used for bit-testing and setting of bitmap fields.
In C/C++ it can be used for bitfield definition, but that is rarely used due to the implementation dependency of this.
A boolean property with false represented by binary zero and true by any non-zero value (preferrably 1).
Maps on C11 to atomic_bool, for thread-safe access.
Maps on C++11 to std::atomic_bool, for thread-safe access.

section.hd: IEEE 754:2008 single-precision binary floating-point format (32 bits)
section.p: A floating point number with size of 4 octets.

section.hd: IEEE 754:2008 double-precision binary floating-point format (64 bits)
section.p: A floating point number with size of 8 octets.
A boolean value that uses a 2 octet size.

In Unicode a code point uniquely identifies a Unicode character, which is either a character or a grapheme (a minimalistic distinctive unit of writing). A character can be composed of multiple graphemes, or of a character with graphemes, so technically a tcChar represents a Unicode code point rather than a character.
Maps on C11 to atomic_char32_t, for thread-safe access.
Maps on C++11 to std::atomic_char32_t, for thread-safe access.
A signed integer with size of 2 octets; Minimum value is -2^15 and maximum value is 2^15-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Int16
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_int_least16_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for int16_t.
A signed integer with size of 4 octets; Minimum value is -2^31 and maximum value is 2^31-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Int32
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_int_least32_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for int32_t.
A signed integer with size of 8 octets; Minimum value is -2^63 and maximum value is 2^63-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Int64
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_int_least64_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for int64_t.
A signed integer with size of 1 octet; Minimum value is -2^7 and maximum value is 2^7-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.SByte
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_int_least8_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for int8_t.
A Unicode string that uses UTF-8 encoding.
This type is similar to the type.string from the acnbase.bset, but only UTF-8 encoding is allowed. In addition, a string of this type is terminated with a NUL character.
Maps to clr-namespace:global:System.String.
Maps on C to char const* for constant properties, and to char[] for non-constant properties. In this case a MaximumCodeUnits limit specification is required.
Maps on C++ to std::string. Note that this type is not atomic, so accesses are only thread-safe if the appropriate accessors are used.
An unsigned integer with size of 2 octets; Minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 2^16-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.UInt16
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_uint_least16_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for uint16_t.
An unsigned integer with size of 4 octets; Minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 2^32-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.UInt32
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_uint_least32_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for uint32_t.
An unsigned integer with size of 8 octets; Minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 2^64-1.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.UInt64
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_uint_least64_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for uint64_t.
An unsigned integer with size of 1 octet; Minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 255.
Maps on Microsoft .NET to clr-namespace:global:System.Byte
Maps on C/C++ to (std::)atomic_uint_least8_t, for thread-safe access, and to accommodate platforms without native support for uint8_t.

Read and write access to the network properties of the device depends on the read and write property attributes of the specified protocol, but also on the role and authorization of the user of the session. If no user.role is specified, access solely depends on the protocol. If any refined user.role behavior is specified on a property, read and/or write access is also controlled by the current user role.

behaviordef.name: user.ReadAll
behaviordef.label: Read Access for All User Roles

section.hd: User Role for Read Access of Properties
section.p: This behavior specifies read access for all user roles. It is typically used in conjunction with other user.role behaviors that provide write access to the property.
An observer has read and write access to the properties that have this behavior. The observer role is the default user role, for which no authentication is required.

section.hd: Observer User Role with Read-only Access
section.p: An observer only has read access and no write access to the properties that have this behavior. The observer role is the default user role, for which no authentication is required.
You can use this behavior to make a property read-only for non-authenticated users.
An operator is a customer representative that has read and write access to the properties that have this behavior.
The operator role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.

section.hd: Operator User Role with Read-only Access
section.p: An operator is a customer representative that has read-only access to the properties that have this behavior.
The operator role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.

section.hd: Application or Process Specialist User Role
section.p: An application or process specialist is a customer representative with specialist knowledge of the application of the device, and therefore is allowed read and write access to the properties that have this behavior.
The specialist role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.
A service engineer is a manufacturer representative with specialist knowledge of the device, and therefore is allowed read and write access to the properties that have this behavior.
The service engineer role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.
A product expert is a manufacturer representative with expert knowledge of the device and its application, and therefore is allowed read and write access to the properties that have this behavior.
The product expert role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.
An administrator is a manufacturer representative with expert knowledge of the device, and therefore is allowed read and write access to the properties that have this behavior.
The administrator role requires authentication and a session should have a time-out.
The administrator role is specifically aimed at write access to otherwise constant properties, like the serial number, typically set at the factory.
The implementation variable name of the property. This sub-property can be used to document a non-systematic variable name of the property in the implementation.
A floating point value in volt representing an electric voltage.
A floating point value in volt representing the root means square of an alternating electric voltage.
A floating point value in cubic meter representing volume.
The volume of matter flowing through the cross-section of a conduit in unit time, expressed in m³/s.

Indicates the entrance of the system into a state which still is inside the specified operating conditions, but without intervention there will be the risk of switching into a state which is outside the specified operating conditions. A warning is reset automatically when its driving condition is no longer present.
